addToWhereClause

public void addToWhereClause(java.lang.String clause)
Adds first element to WHERE clause in the query. If it's not the first element, it is not going to be added, just because then you have to use version of this function with operator parameter

Specified by:
addToWhereClause in interface SQLQuery
Parameters:
clause - element

addToWhereClause

public void addToWhereClause(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> clauses,
                             SQLLogicOperator op)
Adds elements to WHERE clause (joins all of them with op operator) example clauses = [a=b,b=c,c=e],op=and -> query WHERE (a=b and b=c and c=e)

Specified by:
addToWhereClause in interface SQLQuery
Parameters:
clauses - element that is going to be added
op - operator (if it is not the first one

addToFromClause

public void addToFromClause(java.lang.String fromField)
Adds FIRST element to the from clause (if it is not the first one, it will be ignored, just because you have to use version with join)

addToFromClause

public void addToFromClause(java.lang.String fromField,
                            SQLJoinOperator op,
                            java.lang.String on1,
                            java.lang.String on2)
Adds element to from clause. If it is first one, join operator will be ignored.

Specified by:
addToFromClause in interface SQLQuery
Parameters:
fromField - field that is going to be added
op - Join operator (for more than one field
on1 - first field that is going to be joined on
on2 - as the above
